result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Wilde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to keep current on his child support payments and pay arrearage.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:50 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Amy LaCosse present in court via telephone.  Statement by Agent LaCosse - goes over the monies owed.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - mother died and have the child now.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Statement by Agent LaCosse - probation discharges in 2019.

Court adjourned at 1:55 p.m.
Probation review hearing on November 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth J Wilde
Current: 117 N. 7th Ave, Winneconne, WI 54986 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2017)
Prior: 2804 Ctr K, Omro, WI 54963

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:51 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2, and count 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 and orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

18 months of Initial Confinement and 24 months of Extended Supervision, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to keep current on his child support payments and pay arrearage.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 2

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to keep current on his child support payments and pay arrearage.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Further statement by the court - informs the defendant that a probation review hearing will be scheduled in a year and that the court can fashion conditions to include jail time.

Court adjourned at 11:02 a.m.



Note:  After Court I questioned Judge about the CIP & SAP programs.  Per judge, defendant would not be eligible for either program.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

11:50 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests another plea & sentencing date.  Court sets for plea & Sentencing on October 4, 2016 at 10:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:51 a.m.,
By Atty Joey Roeth

10:Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 5, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:19 a.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary hearing at 11-24-2015 10:00 am
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:58 a.m.
